summary.p: 2 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 55; Qurʾānic Text: Q 60:1-60:2; 6 lines per page; Dimensions: 190 x 105mm; Script style: kūfī D.II.
The fragments Arabe 349 (e) (BNF); QUR 372 (Khalili Collection), C.1 (Danish Royal Library), E.H. 25, EH 26 (f. 26), E.H. 28 (Topkapi).belong to the same manuscript.
The catalogue entry by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014) contains the following information:
"Marcel 55
2 fol. 213×293 mm (1.38). Support: thick but transparent parchment, rigid, with the traces of scraper, of yellowish color. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: central bifolium, H1F / F2H .
Text layout: 103×185 мм / 105×190 мм (1.8), 6 lines. Ruling: absent. Diacritics: occasional diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Script: D II. Vocalization: large round red dots.
Verse markers: for individual verses – golden rosettes (type 3.1.2).
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs and verses inscribed in pencil on the upper margins of both sheets in Roman and Arabic letters; the umber of the verse 2 is inscribed in the text.
Stitching: thread is preserved in the punctures of the fold.
Defects: minor stains on the outer margins; margins damaged probably by rodents; ink peeling off on the flesh side (fol. 1v – 2r); text from another fragment has imprinted on fol. 2v.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the letters “BF”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink and old accession number in red pencil “B. 33”.
Old accession numbers: BF (on the wrapping), B. 33 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–2v. Surah 60, verses 1(1)-2(2). Incipit: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم . Explicit: يثقفوكم [يكونوا لكم].

Other fragments of the same manuscript: probably Arabe 349е (BNF); QUR 372 (Halili Collection – copied by Ḥasan, owner Mu‘izz al-Dīn Muḥammad alManṣūrī al-Ḥusaynī); C.1 (Danish Royal Library); EH 25, EH 26 (f. 26), EH 28 (Topkapi).
